009package imagingbook.spectral.dft;
010
011/**
012 * <p>
013 * Interface to be implemented by all one-dimensional DFT/FFT implementations.
014 * See Ch. 18 of [1] for additional details.
015 * </p>
016 * <p>
017 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
018 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
019 * </p>
020 * @see Dft1dDirect
021 * @see Dft1dFast
022 */
023public interface Dft1d {
024        
025        public int getSize();
026        public ScalingMode getScalingMode();
027        
028        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
029        
030        public interface Float extends Dft1d {
031                
032                /**
033                 * Performs an "in-place" DFT forward transformation on the supplied 1D {@code float} data.
034                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
035                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
036                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
037                 */
038                public void forward(float[] gRe, float[] gIm);
039                
040                /**
041                 * Performs an "in-place" DFT inverse transformation on the supplied 1D {@code float} spectrum.
042                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
043                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
044                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
045                 */
046                public void inverse(float[] GRe, float[] GIm);
047                
048                /**
049                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
050                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
051                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
052                 * 
053                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
054                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
055                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
056                 */
057                public void transform(float[] inRe, float[] inIm, boolean forward);
058                
059                default void checkSize(float[] re, float[] im) {
060                        if (re.length != this.getSize())
061                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
062                                        String.format("re: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", re.length, this.getSize()));
063                        
064                        if (im.length != this.getSize())
065                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
066                                        String.format("im: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", im.length, this.getSize()));
067                }
068                
069        }
070        
071        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
072        
073        public interface Double extends Dft1d {
074                
075                /**
076                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT forward transformation on the supplied {@code double} data.
077                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
078                 * 
079                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
080                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
081                 */
082                public void forward(double[] gRe, double[] gIm);
083                
084                /**
085                 * Performs an "in-place" 1D DFT inverse transformation on the supplied {@code double} spectrum.
086                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
087                 * 
088                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
089                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
090                 */
091                public void inverse(double[] GRe, double[] GIm);
092                
093                /**
094                 * Transforms the given 1D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
095                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward) 
096                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be {@code null}.
097                 * 
098                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
099                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
100                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
101                 */
102                public void transform(double[] inRe, double[] inIm, boolean forward);
103                
104                default void checkSize(double[] re, double[] im) {
105                        if (re.length != this.getSize())
106                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
107                                        String.format("re: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", re.length, this.getSize()));
108                        
109                        if (im.length != this.getSize())
110                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
111                                        String.format("im: wrong 1D array size %d (expected %d)", im.length, this.getSize()));
112                }
113                
114        }
115        
116}
